result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy R Roebuck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $103.33 per month commencing 12/01/2015 (w/payment plan fee of $15.00) no early pre-payment of fine, alternate 13 days jail.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of fine and completion of 100 hours community service, and no new criminal law violations.

Perform 100 hours within 6 months of today's date.
06/01/2016 COURT GRANTS EXTENTION OF 1 YEAR FOR COMPLETION OF THE COMMUNITY SERVICE REQUIREMENT.

9/22/2017 - COURT GRANTS AN ADDITIONAL 3 MONTHS TO COMPLETE COMMUNITY SERVICE.  FAILURE TO COMPLETE COMMUNITY SERVICE WILL RESULT IN 30 DAYS JAIL, CONSECUTIVE, AS PENALTY.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Proof of completion of Community Service, filed by WCS.
Review hearing on January 31, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Billy R Roebuck not in court.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The court grants the defendant an extension to the end of January for failure to complete the community service by January 31, 2018.  The court will not grant any further extensions and the court will impose 30 days jail consecutive as penalty for failure to complete the community service.  Review hearing scheduled for January 31, 2018 at 10:00 am.
From WCS dated 12/21/17 re defendant's failure to complete community service and anticipation it be completed by end of year.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on December 22, 2017 at 09:00 am.

From WCS dated 9/15/17 re defendant's failure to complete community service and request for extension to complete.
  **Reviewed by Judge Michael J. Aprahamian on 9/22/17; 3 month extension to complete, penalty for non compliance 30 days jail.**
Review hearing on September 25, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Billy R Roebuck in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant has not completed any of the court ordered community service.    The Court grants an additional 3 months to complete the community service.  Failure to complete the community service Defendant to serve 30 days jail straight time. The Defendant to report to WCS following court today.  Review hearing scheduled for September 25, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on June 21, 2017 at 08:30 am.

From WCS dated 6/1/17 re defendant's failure to complete community service.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 6/6/17; Schedule hearing.

Defendant Billy R Roebuck in court, in custody.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the ordered community service.  Defendant advises his counsel told him he could just pay his ticket.  Court will extend the time to complete community service.  Defendant has 1 year to complete community service.  Defendant may be released from custody.
Bail/bond hearing on June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Branch 9 Only.  Non compliance with WCS for community service.
From WCS dated 5/3/16 re defendant's failure to complete community service.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Billy R Roebuck in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows:  FINE: $605.00 to be paid at $103.33 per month each month, no early prepayment of fine, 13 days jail consecutive as penalty for failure to pay. DNA Surcharge and sample waived by the Court.  Complete 100 hours Community Service within the 6 months.  Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees, completion of 100 hours of community service and no new criminal law violations.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-30-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Billy R Roebuck in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date in 30 - 45 days. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on September 25, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Billy R Roebuck in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises why her client was not present at the last hearing. Defense requests signature bond be reinstated. Court orders warrant quashed. Court orders signature bond reinstated. Defense is requesting another date in 30 days. Court grants request. Defense to advise on the next date how this matter will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Br. 9 only
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery in court.   Defendant Billy R Roebuck did not appear at 8:51 a.m..   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court revokes and forfeits bail and issues a capias - Br. 9 only.
Hearing on August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Billy R Roebuck in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Billy R Roebuck in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant had provided the court with a letter that he is eligible for the public defender.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on June 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Billy R Roebuck in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
